sentences.english: And they laughed him to scorn.
'You're behaving in an unladylike fashion, ' sniffed Mother.
sentences.chinese: “你的行为不像淑女，”母亲嗤笑道。

sentences.english: With salvation's walls surrounded, Thou mayst smile at all thy foes.
sentences.chinese: 救恩墙垣四围环绕，尽可嗤笑众仇敌。

sentences.english: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.
sentences.chinese: 它嗤笑城内的喧囔，不听赶牲口的喝声。

sentences.english: You have made us a reproach to our neighbors, the scorn and derision of those around us.
sentences.chinese: 你使我们受邻国的羞辱，被四围的人嗤笑讥刺。

sentences.english: All who pass by her scoff and shake their fists.
sentences.chinese: 凡经过的人都必摇手嗤笑她。

sentences.english: Cheng Yakun scoffs at a sound.
53They laughed at him, knowing that she was dead.
sentences.chinese: 他们晓得女儿已经死了，就嗤笑耶稣。

sentences.english: This is the word that the Lord has spoken against him: ' 'The Virgin Daughter of Zion despises you and mocks you.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华论他这样说，锡安的处女藐视你，嗤笑你。

sentences.english: People began to laugh at him.
His suggestion was greeted with hoots of laughter.
sentences.chinese: 他的建议引起了阵阵嗤笑。

definition: to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
see 嗤之以鼻[chi1 zhi1 yi3 bi2]
to cast sidelong glances at sb
